articles.title: Contact tracers in N.Y. couldn’t get partygoers to answer the phone, so they issued subpoenas — and it worked - The Philadelphia Inquirer
articles.description: The legal strategy used for coronavirus contact tracing in Rockland County shows just how difficult it may be to get Americans to comply with this key part of many pandemic response plans.
articles.content:
After a woman in Rockland County, N.Y., admitted to throwing her daughter a party while showing coronavirus symptoms, contact tracers sprung into action.
